arts.ttl: Hull City boss Ruben Selles delivers message to Tigers fans after making unbeaten start
arts.sum: Despite the late concession and subsequent understandable dismay at falling to win a game Selles' side deserved to claim maximum points from, all the players and staff were quick to venture onto the pitch and applaud the supporters, who had backed them well throughout the night, and were well received in return. "We did that, and we continue doing that at the end of the game because they have been supporting us for 95 minutes." the Spaniard told Hull Live.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles gets perfect response from Hull City with encouraging verdict despite frustration
arts.sum: "I think the players for the second half of the game played really good football in some moments, and they were as competitive as the opponent, and the opponent is a really good team in the league. With Watford pushing for a late leveller, Kwadwo Baah's run and cross wasn't stopped, allowing Vata to slide past Ivor Pandur, and break City hearts, but despite that, Selles was enthused by what he saw after just two training sessions with his squad, and felt it already looked like a performance in his style.
How the game at the MKM Stadium unfolded as Rocco Vata's first goal for the club rescued a point with a late equaliser.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles starts Hull tenure with draw against Watford
arts.sum: The Tigers are without a win since October 1.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs Watford as Ruben Selles gets glimpse of potential
arts.sum: Ryan Giles: Decent first half, but couldn't get forward as much as he would have liked owing to the way Watford pinned City back, at times, bar when he fizzed a shot at goal. Steven Alzate: Handed a first start by Selles and looked neat and tidy, but City found their midfield often overrun in the first period, had a greater involvement in the second half and looked really good.
The Hornets return to action after 10 days without a game

arts.ttl: Club chief rules out signing Hull City man – Player said to be very disappointed
arts.sum: According to a claim in the Turkish media, Trabzonspor are not considering a return for Hull City attacker Abdülkadir Ömür. The 25-year-old signed for the Championship side from Trabzonspor during the last January transfer window. Kuzey Ekspres have reported on the latest situation regarding the future of the Hull City player following recent reports he The post Club chief rules out signing Hull City man – Player said to be very disappointed appeared first on Sport Witness.

arts.ttl: Predicted Hull City line up for Watford as Ruben Selles eyes winning start to MKM Stadium reign
arts.sum: The Spaniard's first starting line-up will be an interesting one, given he will have watched every City game back on video, as well as seeing a couple of training sessions for himself. City's predicted starting XI: Pandur, Giles, McLoughlin, Hughes, Coyle (c), Alzate, Slater, Longman, Palmer, Kamara, Bedia.

arts.ttl: Inside Selles' first Hull City press call as new boss vows to shake things up
arts.sum: There was little fanfare, not even an introduction for Ruben Selles as he greeted the media for the first as Hull City boss within the tight confines of the MKM Stadium on Tuesday night. No grand statements, no ticker tape reception or flamboyant entrance, just a very business-like approach which will be music to the ears of his players, who want a manager who does his talking on the training ground so they can do theirs on the pitch.

arts.ttl: Referee named for Watford's trip to Hull
arts.sum: Leigh Doughty is due to referee Watford's trip to Hull City in the Championship tonight.
